page.title: 02PAST AND PRESENT
page.content: The village of Walton on Trent,together with the neighbouring village of Rosliston,was mentioned in the original Domesday Book. Most of the land then belonged to Earl Algar and was valued at ten pounds. Today,the land is very valuable not only for its rich farmland but for its gravel deposits and potential oil deposits.(An oil exploration team surveyed the area in the Spring of 1985).Coal,too,is mined from under part of the area. A large part of the land belongs to Catton Hall Estate and the farms are let to tenant farmers. At Borough Hill there are the remains of an Iron Age fort and at Fatholm in 1984 they found evidence of people living here six thousand years ago.
